abstract: Robert Friedland, one of Canada’s most prominent mining developers, resigned as chief executive of Ivanhoe Mines, ending a long-running battle between the executive and Rio Tinto.
snippet: Robert Friedland, one of Canada’s most prominent mining developers, resigned as chief executive of Ivanhoe Mines, ending a long-running battle between the executive and Rio Tinto.
lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — Robert Friedland, one of Canada’s most prominent mining developers, resigned as chief executive of Ivanhoe Mines on Wednesday as part of a $1.8 billion equity financing agreement with Rio Tinto, the company’s major shareholder.

headline.main: Mining Chief Resigns as Part of Deal With Rio Tinto
